intro: Plectritis glabra, commonly known as field scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pale blue or white. Plectritis glabra is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
